content.text:
<task>
Please verify the Git configuration backup and restoration logic.

1.  Check if `terminal_backup/.gitconfig` exists and contains the correct user information (name: haint, email: thanhhai9x98@gmail.com).
2.  Read `terminal_backup/install.sh` and verify the logic for restoring `.gitconfig` (it should copy from backup to `~/.gitconfig`).
3.  Read `terminal_backup/restore_instructions.txt` and verify the Git configuration instructions.

Report back with your findings.
</task>

The user wants me to verify three files related to Git configuration backup and restoration. Let me read all three files at once to check:
1. terminal_backup/.gitconfig - check for user info (name: haint, email: thanhhai9x98@gmail.com)
2. terminal_backup/install.sh - verify restoration logic
3. terminal_backup/restore_instructions.txt - verify Git configuration instructions

<file><path>terminal_backup/install.sh</path>
<content lines="1-308">
  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | 
  3 | # Terminal Setup Installer for Nobara 42 (Fedora-based)
  4 | # This script restores terminal configuration from backup
  5 | 
  6 | set -e
  7 | 
  8 | SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
  9 | GREEN='\033[0;32m'
 10 | YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
 11 | RED='\033[0;31m'
 12 | NC='\033[0m' # No Color
 13 | 
 14 | echo -e "${GREEN}=== Terminal Setup Installer for Nobara 42 ===${NC}"
 15 | echo ""
 16 | 
 17 | # Function to print status
 18 | print_status() {
 19 |     echo -e "${GREEN}[✓]${NC} $1"
 20 | }
 21 | 
 22 | print_warning() {
 23 |     echo -e "${YELLOW}[!]${NC} $1"
 24 | }
 25 | 
 26 | print_error() {
 27 |     echo -e "${RED}[✗]${NC} $1"
 28 | }
 29 | 
 30 | # 1. System Update
 31 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Updating system...${NC}"
 32 | sudo dnf update -y
 33 | print_status "System updated"
 34 | 
 35 | # 2. Install Core Tools
 36 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Installing core tools...${NC}"
 37 | sudo dnf install -y zsh git curl wget util-linux-user
 38 | print_status "Core tools installed (zsh, git, curl, wget, util-linux-user)"
 39 | 
 40 | # 3. Install Terminal Tools
 41 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Installing terminal tools...${NC}"
 42 | 
 43 | # Starship
 44 | if sudo dnf install -y starship 2>/dev/null; then
 45 |     print_status "Starship installed via dnf"
 46 | else
 47 |     print_warning "Starship not in repos, installing via official script..."
 48 |     curl -sS https://starship.rs/install.sh | sh -s -- -y
 49 |     print_status "Starship installed via official script"
 50 | fi
 51 | 
 52 | # Atuin
 53 | if sudo dnf install -y atuin 2>/dev/null; then
 54 |     print_status "Atuin installed via dnf"
 55 | else
 56 |     print_warning "Atuin not in repos, installing via official script..."
 57 |     curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://setup.atuin.sh | sh
 58 |     print_status "Atuin installed via official script"
 59 | fi
 60 | 
 61 | # Fastfetch
 62 | sudo dnf install -y fastfetch
 63 | print_status "Fastfetch installed"
 64 | 
 65 | # Kitty
 66 | sudo dnf install -y kitty
 67 | print_status "Kitty terminal installed"
 68 | 
 69 | # Podman & Podman Compose
 70 | sudo dnf install -y podman podman-compose
 71 | print_status "Podman and Podman Compose installed"
 72 | 
 73 | # Setup Qdrant with Podman (auto-start on boot)
 74 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Setting up Qdrant vector database...${NC}"
 75 | 
 76 | # Create storage directory for Qdrant
 77 | QDRANT_STORAGE="$HOME/qdrant_storage"
 78 | mkdir -p "$QDRANT_STORAGE"
 79 | print_status "Qdrant storage directory created at $QDRANT_STORAGE"
 80 | 
 81 | # Pull Qdrant image
 82 | podman pull qdrant/qdrant
 83 | print_status "Qdrant image pulled"
 84 | 
 85 | # Create systemd user service directory
 86 | mkdir -p "$HOME/.config/systemd/user"
 87 | 
 88 | # Create systemd service file for Qdrant
 89 | cat > "$HOME/.config/systemd/user/qdrant.service" << EOF
 90 | [Unit]
 91 | Description=Qdrant Vector Database Container
 92 | After=network-online.target
 93 | Wants=network-online.target
 94 | 
 95 | [Service]
 96 | Type=simple
 97 | Restart=always
 98 | RestartSec=5
 99 | ExecStartPre=-/usr/bin/podman stop -t 10 qdrant
100 | ExecStartPre=-/usr/bin/podman rm qdrant
101 | ExecStart=/usr/bin/podman run --rm --name qdrant \\
102 |     -p 6333:6333 -p 6334:6334 \\
103 |     -v $HOME/qdrant_storage:/qdrant/storage:Z \\
104 |     qdrant/qdrant
105 | ExecStop=/usr/bin/podman stop -t 10 qdrant
106 | 
107 | [Install]
108 | WantedBy=default.target
109 | EOF
110 | print_status "Qdrant systemd service file created"
111 | 
112 | # Reload systemd user daemon
113 | systemctl --user daemon-reload
114 | print_status "Systemd user daemon reloaded"
115 | 
116 | # Enable and start Qdrant service
117 | systemctl --user enable --now qdrant
118 | print_status "Qdrant service enabled and started"
119 | 
120 | # Enable lingering so service starts on boot without login
121 | loginctl enable-linger "$USER"
122 | print_status "User lingering enabled (Qdrant will start on boot)"
123 | 
124 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Qdrant is now running at http://localhost:6333${NC}"
125 | 
126 | # 4. Install Zsh Plugins
127 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Installing Zsh plugins...${NC}"
128 | sudo dnf install -y zsh-autosuggestions zsh-syntax-highlighting
129 | print_status "zsh-autosuggestions and zsh-syntax-highlighting installed"
130 | 
131 | # zsh-autocomplete - check if available in repos or clone from GitHub
132 | ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_SYSTEM="/usr/share/zsh-autocomplete/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh"
133 | ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL="$HOME/.local/share/zsh/plugins/zsh-autocomplete"
134 | 
135 | if sudo dnf install -y zsh-autocomplete 2>/dev/null && [ -f "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_SYSTEM" ]; then
136 |     print_status "zsh-autocomplete installed via dnf"
137 | else
138 |     print_warning "zsh-autocomplete not in repos, cloning from GitHub..."
139 |     mkdir -p "$HOME/.local/share/zsh/plugins"
140 |     if [ -d "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL" ]; then
141 |         rm -rf "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL"
142 |     fi
143 |     git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/marlonrichert/zsh-autocomplete.git "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL"
144 |     print_status "zsh-autocomplete cloned to $ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL"
145 | fi
146 | 
147 | # 5. Restore Config Files
148 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Restoring configuration files...${NC}"
149 | 
150 | # .zshrc
151 | if [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/.zshrc" ]; then
152 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/.zshrc" ~/
153 |     
154 |     # Update zsh-autocomplete path if using local installation
155 |     if [ ! -f "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_SYSTEM" ] && [ -d "$ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL" ]; then
156 |         sed -i "s|source /usr/share/zsh-autocomplete/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh|source $ZSH_AUTOCOMPLETE_LOCAL/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh|g" ~/.zshrc
157 |         print_status ".zshrc copied and updated with local zsh-autocomplete path"
158 |     else
159 |         print_status ".zshrc copied"
160 |     fi
161 | fi
162 | 
163 | # .bashrc
164 | if [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/.bashrc" ]; then
165 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/.bashrc" ~/
166 |     print_status ".bashrc copied"
167 | fi
168 | 
169 | # .gitconfig
170 | if [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/.gitconfig" ]; then
171 |     if [ -f ~/.gitconfig ]; then
172 |         cp ~/.gitconfig ~/.gitconfig.backup
173 |         print_warning "Existing .gitconfig backed up to ~/.gitconfig.backup"
174 |     fi
175 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/.gitconfig" ~/
176 |     print_status ".gitconfig copied (Git user: haint <thanhhai9x98@gmail.com>)"
177 | fi
178 | 
179 | # Create .config directory if it doesn't exist
180 | mkdir -p ~/.config
181 | 
182 | # starship.toml
183 | if [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/starship/starship.toml" ]; then
184 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/starship/starship.toml" ~/.config/
185 |     print_status "starship.toml copied"
186 | elif [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/starship.toml" ]; then
187 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/starship.toml" ~/.config/
188 |     print_status "starship.toml copied"
189 | fi
190 | 
191 | # atuin config
192 | if [ -d "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/atuin" ]; then
193 |     mkdir -p ~/.config/atuin
194 |     cp -r "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/atuin/"* ~/.config/atuin/
195 |     print_status "atuin config copied"
196 | fi
197 | 
198 | # fastfetch config
199 | if [ -d "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/fastfetch" ]; then
200 |     mkdir -p ~/.config/fastfetch
201 |     cp -r "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/fastfetch/"* ~/.config/fastfetch/
202 |     print_status "fastfetch config copied"
203 | fi
204 | 
205 | # fastfetch custom logo
206 | if [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/images/jedi.png" ]; then
207 |     mkdir -p ~/.config/fastfetch/assets
208 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/images/jedi.png" ~/.config/fastfetch/assets/
209 |     print_status "fastfetch custom logo (jedi.png) copied"
210 | fi
211 | 
212 | # fish config
213 | if [ -d "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/fish" ]; then
214 |     mkdir -p ~/.config/fish
215 |     cp -r "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/fish/"* ~/.config/fish/
216 |     print_status "fish config copied"
217 | fi
218 | 
219 | # kitty config
220 | if [ -d "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/kitty" ]; then
221 |     mkdir -p ~/.config/kitty
222 |     cp -r "$SCRIPT_DIR/.config/kitty/"* ~/.config/kitty/
223 |     print_status "kitty config copied"
224 | fi
225 | 
226 | # 6. Restore Fonts
227 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Installing fonts...${NC}"
228 | if [ -d "$SCRIPT_DIR/fonts" ]; then
229 |     mkdir -p ~/.local/share/fonts
230 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/fonts/"*.ttf ~/.local/share/fonts/ 2>/dev/null || true
231 |     fc-cache -fv
232 |     print_status "Fonts installed and cache updated"
233 | else
234 |     print_warning "No fonts directory found in backup"
235 | fi
236 | 
237 | # 7. Install and Configure VSCode
238 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Installing and configuring VSCode...${NC}"
239 | 
240 | # Check if VSCode is already installed
241 | if command -v code &> /dev/null; then
242 |     print_status "VSCode is already installed"
243 | else
244 |     print_warning "VSCode not found, installing..."
245 |     # Import Microsoft GPG key
246 |     sudo rpm --import https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc
247 |     # Add VSCode repository
248 |     echo -e "[code]\nname=Visual Studio Code\nbaseurl=https://packages.microsoft.com/yumrepos/vscode\nenabled=1\ngpgcheck=1\ngpgkey=https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc" | sudo tee /etc/yum.repos.d/vscode.repo > /dev/null
249 |     sudo dnf check-update || true
250 |     sudo dnf install -y code
251 |     print_status "VSCode installed"
252 | fi
253 | 
254 | # Restore VSCode settings
255 | VSCODE_USER_DIR="$HOME/.config/Code/User"
256 | mkdir -p "$VSCODE_USER_DIR"
257 | 
258 | if [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/vscode/settings.json" ]; then
259 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/vscode/settings.json" "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/"
260 |     print_status "VSCode settings.json restored"
261 | fi
262 | 
263 | if [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/vscode/keybindings.json" ]; then
264 |     cp "$SCRIPT_DIR/vscode/keybindings.json" "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/"
265 |     print_status "VSCode keybindings.json restored"
266 | fi
267 | 
268 | if [ -d "$SCRIPT_DIR/vscode/snippets" ]; then
269 |     mkdir -p "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/snippets"
270 |     cp -r "$SCRIPT_DIR/vscode/snippets/"* "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/snippets/"
271 |     print_status "VSCode snippets restored"
272 | fi
273 | 
274 | # Install VSCode extensions
275 | if [ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/vscode/extensions.txt" ]; then
276 |     echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Installing VSCode extensions...${NC}"
277 |     while IFS= read -r extension || [ -n "$extension" ]; do
278 |         if [ -n "$extension" ]; then
279 |             echo "Installing extension: $extension"
280 |             code --install-extension "$extension" --force 2>/dev/null || print_warning "Failed to install: $extension"
281 |         fi
282 |     done < "$SCRIPT_DIR/vscode/extensions.txt"
283 |     print_status "VSCode extensions installation complete"
284 | fi
285 | 
286 | # Restore Kilo Code global storage
287 | VSCODE_GLOBAL_STORAGE="$HOME/.config/Code/User/globalStorage"
288 | if [ -d "$SCRIPT_DIR/vscode/globalStorage/kilocode.kilo-code" ]; then
289 |     echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Restoring Kilo Code configuration...${NC}"
290 |     mkdir -p "$VSCODE_GLOBAL_STORAGE"
291 |     cp -r "$SCRIPT_DIR/vscode/globalStorage/kilocode.kilo-code" "$VSCODE_GLOBAL_STORAGE/"
292 |     print_status "Kilo Code global storage restored"
293 | fi
294 | 
295 | # 8. Set Default Shell to Zsh
296 | echo -e "${GREEN}>>> Setting default shell to zsh...${NC}"
297 | if [ "$SHELL" != "$(which zsh)" ]; then
298 |     chsh -s "$(which zsh)"
299 |     print_status "Default shell changed to zsh (will take effect on next login)"
300 | else
301 |     print_status "Zsh is already the default shell"
302 | fi
303 | 
304 | echo ""
305 | echo -e "${GREEN}=== Installation Complete! ===${NC}"
306 | echo ""
307 | echo "Please log out and log back in for the shell change to take effect."
308 | echo "Then open a new terminal to enjoy your restored setup!"
</content>
</file>
<file><path>terminal_backup/restore_instructions.txt</path>
<content lines="1-140">
  1 | Terminal Backup Restore Instructions
  2 | ====================================
  3 | 
  4 | This backup contains terminal configuration for Nobara 42 (Fedora-based).
  5 | 
  6 | AUTOMATIC INSTALLATION
  7 | ----------------------
  8 | Run the install.sh script to automatically install and configure everything:
  9 | 
 10 |     chmod +x install.sh
 11 |     ./install.sh
 12 | 
 13 | MANUAL RESTORATION
 14 | ------------------
 15 | 
 16 | System-wide Zsh plugins referenced in terminal_backup/.zshrc:
 17 | 
 18 | - /usr/share/zsh-autosuggestions/zsh-autosuggestions.zsh
 19 |   Restore with: sudo dnf install zsh-autosuggestions
 20 | 
 21 | - /usr/share/zsh-syntax-highlighting/zsh-syntax-highlighting.zsh
 22 |   Restore with: sudo dnf install zsh-syntax-highlighting
 23 | 
 24 | - /usr/share/zsh-autocomplete/zsh-autocomplete.plugin.zsh
 25 |   Restore with: sudo dnf install zsh-autocomplete
 26 |   (or clone from https://github.com/marlonrichert/zsh-autocomplete)
 27 | 
 28 | Local plugin locations checked (no directories found to copy):
 29 | - ~/.oh-my-zsh/custom/plugins
 30 | - ~/.local/share/zsh/plugins
 31 | 
 32 | GIT CONFIGURATION
 33 | -----------------
 34 | 
 35 | Global Git configuration is backed up in .gitconfig (user: haint, email: thanhhai9x98@gmail.com).
 36 | The install.sh script will automatically restore this file to ~/.gitconfig, backing up any existing one.
 37 | 
 38 | To manually restore:
 39 |     cp .gitconfig ~/.gitconfig
 40 | 
 41 | VSCODE RESTORATION
 42 | ------------------
 43 | 
 44 | VSCode settings are backed up in the vscode/ directory:
 45 | 
 46 | - vscode/settings.json     -> ~/.config/Code/User/settings.json
 47 | - vscode/keybindings.json  -> ~/.config/Code/User/keybindings.json (if exists)
 48 | - vscode/snippets/         -> ~/.config/Code/User/snippets/ (if exists)
 49 | - vscode/extensions.txt    -> List of installed extensions
 50 | 
 51 | To manually restore VSCode:
 52 | 
 53 | 1. Install VSCode:
 54 |    sudo rpm --import https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc
 55 |    sudo sh -c 'echo -e "[code]\nname=Visual Studio Code\nbaseurl=https://packages.microsoft.com/yumrepos/vscode\nenabled=1\ngpgcheck=1\ngpgkey=https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc" > /etc/yum.repos.d/vscode.repo'
 56 |    sudo dnf install -y code
 57 | 
 58 | 2. Restore settings:
 59 |    mkdir -p ~/.config/Code/User
 60 |    cp vscode/settings.json ~/.config/Code/User/
 61 | 
 62 | 3. Install extensions:
 63 |    while read ext; do code --install-extension "$ext"; done < vscode/extensions.txt
 64 | 
 65 | KILO CODE EXTENSION
 66 | -------------------
 67 | 
 68 | Kilo Code configuration is backed up in:
 69 | - vscode/globalStorage/kilocode.kilo-code/ -> ~/.config/Code/User/globalStorage/kilocode.kilo-code/
 70 | 
 71 | This includes Kilo Code's modes, settings, and cached data.
 72 | 
 73 | The settings.json also contains kilo-code.allowedCommands and kilo-code.deniedCommands settings.
 74 | 
 75 | To manually restore Kilo Code configuration:
 76 |     mkdir -p ~/.config/Code/User/globalStorage
 77 |     cp -r vscode/globalStorage/kilocode.kilo-code ~/.config/Code/User/globalStorage/
 78 | 
 79 | QDRANT VECTOR DATABASE
 80 | ----------------------
 81 | 
 82 | The install.sh script automatically sets up Qdrant using Podman with systemd for auto-start on boot.
 83 | 
 84 | What gets configured:
 85 | - Qdrant storage directory: ~/qdrant_storage
 86 | - Systemd user service: ~/.config/systemd/user/qdrant.service
 87 | - Ports exposed: 6333 (HTTP API), 6334 (gRPC)
 88 | - User lingering enabled for boot startup without login
 89 | 
 90 | To manually set up Qdrant:
 91 | 
 92 | 1. Install Podman:
 93 |    sudo dnf install -y podman
 94 | 
 95 | 2. Create storage directory:
 96 |    mkdir -p ~/qdrant_storage
 97 | 
 98 | 3. Pull the Qdrant image:
 99 |    podman pull qdrant/qdrant
100 | 
101 | 4. Create the systemd service file at ~/.config/systemd/user/qdrant.service:
102 |    
103 |    [Unit]
104 |    Description=Qdrant Vector Database Container
105 |    After=network-online.target
106 |    Wants=network-online.target
107 | 
108 |    [Service]
109 |    Type=simple
110 |    Restart=always
111 |    RestartSec=5
112 |    ExecStartPre=-/usr/bin/podman stop -t 10 qdrant
113 |    ExecStartPre=-/usr/bin/podman rm qdrant
114 |    ExecStart=/usr/bin/podman run --rm --name qdrant \
115 |        -p 6333:6333 -p 6334:6334 \
116 |        -v $HOME/qdrant_storage:/qdrant/storage:Z \
117 |        qdrant/qdrant
118 |    ExecStop=/usr/bin/podman stop -t 10 qdrant
119 | 
120 |    [Install]
121 |    WantedBy=default.target
122 | 
123 | 5. Enable and start the service:
124 |    systemctl --user daemon-reload
125 |    systemctl --user enable --now qdrant
126 | 
127 | 6. Enable lingering for boot startup:
128 |    loginctl enable-linger $USER
129 | 
130 | Managing Qdrant:
131 | - Check status: systemctl --user status qdrant
132 | - Stop: systemctl --user stop qdrant
133 | - Start: systemctl --user start qdrant
134 | - View logs: journalctl --user -u qdrant -f
135 | - Access API: http://localhost:6333
136 | - Web UI: http://localhost:6333/dashboard
137 | 
138 | BACKED UP EXTENSIONS
139 | --------------------
140 | See vscode/extensions.txt for the full list of installed extensions.
</content>
</file>
</files>
